topics.body: Anyone ever have that feeling where you have an awesome idea for like a video or picture or somesuch, but you completely lack the talent to actually make it, and it feels too late to learn it because it would take you way too long to get to the point where it would look the way you so clearly see it in your head?
topics.author: 558e25d36368721e6200039d

topics.body:
"@CobaltTheMadMage":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/559b178363687246d80021bd#post_559b178363687246d80021bd
I think that's the first problem of any beginner artist
topics.author: 5239db6da4c72d22d9000358

topics.body:
"@CobaltTheMadMage":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/559b178363687246d80021bd#post_559b178363687246d80021bd
with me it's more along the lines of "you don't need this you stupid fuck get this sick shit out of your head" but yeah i feel your pain

there are a lot of things i wish i had the time/patience for, and to illustrate thought seems like a very useful ability

Think of it as a tiny Shia lebouf constantly screaming in your ear until you succeed

"@hype":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/559b186863687235a10005b2#post_559b186863687235a10005b2
Huh, well fortunately for me it's just stuff like being able to picture a show-style ponies animation for "this":http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=PAjJXil3UOE song. Everything. Character designs, choreography- only thing I don't have a perfect mental image for would be the fight scene during the musical interlude.
